Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section and contains many small white inclusions, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of two lines of black-painted demotic text.
Curator's comments: Being studied for publication by Bryan Kraemer. Cemeteries and Osireion Excavations Group
Bibliographic references: Frankfort 1933 / The Cenotaph of Seti I at Abydos (no.9,p.95)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393840) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393840)
Almásy-Martin 2020 / Demotic, Greek and Coptic ostraca from Abydos in the British Museum (no.20)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.BM Abydos Dem. 20 (Edition abbreviation according to Oates et al. 2001)
